title: Introduction to Search Engines
body: Full-text search is a technique for searching documents stored in a database.

title: Advanced Query Processing
body: Boolean queries combine multiple search terms using AND OR operators for complex retrieval.

title: Building an Inverted Index
body: An inverted index maps terms to the documents containing them for fast lookup.

title: BM25 Scoring Algorithm
body: BM25 is a ranking function used by search engines to estimate the relevance of documents.

title: Fuzzy Search with Levenshtein Automata
body: Fuzzy search finds terms within an edit distance of the query term using automata.

title: Phrase Queries and Position Indexes
body: Phrase queries require position information to verify that terms appear in sequence.

title: Wildcard Queries with Finite Automata
body: Wildcard patterns are compiled into deterministic finite automata for efficient matching.

title: Segment Merging Strategies
body: Segment merging reduces the number of segments to improve query performance.

title: Crash Recovery in Search Systems
body: Write-ahead logging and atomic operations ensure data integrity after crashes.

title: Distributed Search Architecture
body: Sharding distributes index data across multiple nodes for horizontal scaling.
